intro: Ixonanthes lucida, commonly known as the shining ixonanthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
